bit.name: Do Not Re-Use Parts When Looping
bit.tooltip: This option will hurt performance on effects with very short duration.

bit.name: Use Parent Position But World Orientation
Cannot Be Restarted
bit.tooltip: Will help performance for parallel events of different lengths, if the effect is unlikely to be reused

bit.name: Force Use Own Lightprobe
bit.tooltip: Do not adopt parent object's lightprobe, even when it's available

int32.name: Fixed Random Seed
int32.tooltip: If this is non-zero, the effect will usually be exactly repeatable

tagblock.name: Locations
tagblock.comment:
In addition to the marker in the render model there are several special marker names:
replace Replace allows you to use the same effect with different markers. Damage transition effects support this for example.
gravity, up The direction of gravity (down) and the opposite direction (up). Always supplied
normal Vector pointing directly away from the surface you collided with. Supplied for effects from collision.
forward The 'negative incident' vector i.e. the direction the object is moving in. Most commonly used to generated decals. Supplied for effects from collision.
backward The 'incident' vector i.e. the opposite of the direction the object is moving in. Supplied for effects from collision.
reflection The way the effect would reflect off the surface it hit. Supplied for effects from collision.
root The object root (pivot). These can used for all effects which are associated with an object.
impact The location of a havok impact.
water_surface Point of the effect projected to the water surface above it. Otherwise it just returns the effect position.
child The location of the last detonated projectile, in case the parent object is a weapon (tracers only)

bit.name: Track Sub-Frame Movements
bit.tooltip: When effect moves multiple times within one frame, update location each time

bit.name: Never Stagger Across Markers
bit.tooltip: Even if this effect is told to stagger across available markers, always fire from all instances

bit.name: Create Even When Event Loops Back to Self

enum32.name: Runtime Base Group Tag
enum32.tooltip: This should be set to match the below "Type" tag reference, any object should use "object".

tagRef.name: Type
tagRef.tooltip: The above "Runtime Base Group Tag" field should match this reference.

bit.name: Particles Continue As Usual When Offscreen

float32.name: Near Fade Range
float32.tooltip: distance beyond cutoff over which particles fade

float32.name: Near Fade Cuttoff
float32.tooltip: distance in front of camera where fade is complete*

float32.name: Near Fade Override
float32.tooltip: distance in front of camera where fade is complete

tagblock.name: Emitters
tagblock.comment: XYZ controls that offset the emitter's origin from the original location
vector that changes the initial direction of the emitter
defines the size of the emitter
determines the angle at which particles are emitted
determines the max tilt for particle axis
number of particles that are spawned at the birth of the effect
max number of particles allowed to exist at one time
number of particles that are spawned every second from the emitters
the number of seconds a particle will live after emission

comment.title: Particle Self Acceleration (World Units Per Second Per Second)
Particle Initial Velocity (World Units Per Second)
Particle Initial Rotation Rate (360 Degree Rotations Per Second)

tagblock.comment: controls the overall tint of the particle

int32.name: Runtime m Constant Per Particle Properties!
Runtime m Constant Over Time Properties!
